New Records: Cleveland ended a streak of 11 losses in postseason elimination games dating to Game 6 of 1997 World Series.
David Fry hit the second pinch-homer in Cleveland postseason history after Hank Majeski in Game 4 of the 1954 World Series.

David Fry hit the fourth go-ahead pinch home run in postseason history when trailing in seventh inning or later after the Los Angeles Dodgers’ Kirk Gibson in the 1988 World Series, Toronto’s Ed Sprague in the 1992 World Series and Atlanta’s Eric Hinske in the 2010 NL Division Series.
44,923 fans set a playoff attendance record for the second straight day at 25-year-old Comerica Park.
Key Match Events: David Fry had a go-ahead, two-run homer in the seventh inning.
David Fry bunted home an insurance run in the ninth.
Emmanuel Clase retired five outs for his third multi-inning save of the year.
Zach McKinstry homered in the fifth off Tanner Bibee.
Wenceel Pérez hit a run-scoring single in the sixth.
José Ramírez hit a solo home run in the fifth inning.
Brayan Rocchio slid home headfirst to beat Will Vest's backhand flip, boosting the lead to 5-3.
Pinch-hitter Justyn-Henry Malloy doubled leading off the ninth, advanced on Parker Meadows’ groundout and scored on Jace Jung’s groundout.
Emmanuel Clase struck out Matt Vierling to end the game.
Pre-Game Insights: AL Cy Young Award favorite Tarik Skubal will start Game 5 for the Tigers on Saturday night in Cleveland.
LHP Matthew Boyd may start Game 5 for the Guardians, whose last Game 5 was a loss to the Yankees in the 2022 ALCS.
Post-Match Reflections: David Fry is one of the best baseball players in this league,” Guardians manager Stephen Vogt said.
It’s win or go home,” Vogt said. “You want your best pitchers out there as long as possible.
It’s always comforting to have Tarik Skubal on the mound,” Detroit manager A.J. Hinch said.
We’re still one win away,” Detroit first baseman Spencer Torkeslon said. “That’s the mindset. We don’t want it easy. We knew it wasn’t going to be easy.

We’ve shown that all year long, that’s who these guys are,” Fry said. “We have a bunch of tough dudes. We get down 2-1 and we’re in the locker room like it’s just another day. We show up ready to play to try and get a win. And let’s go win Game 5.
Such a great baseball game,” Vogt said.
I was really excited to get to the mound, especially getting the trust back from the manager to get me in that role and that responsibility,” Clase said through an interpreter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Carpenter injured his left hamstring when he scored in the sixth and was pinch hit for in the seventh.
Lane Thomas ended the Guardians’ 20-inning scoreless streak with a two-out RBI single in the first off Reese Olson.
